Description:
Moz is looking for a natural problem solver with a strong interest in fulfilling the business' expanding appetite for data and helping define our data analytics roadmap. Role involvement will be in all parts of the BI process > from data acquisition to final presentation. The engineer will develop reports and self-service tools for internal customers via Domo and Amazon Quicksight from data housed in log files, Redshift, S3 buckets, datashares, and 3rd party API integrations.
This is a fully remote position.
Responsibilities:
Act as the subject matter expert for sourcing and transforming diverse, structured data across the Ziff Davis product platforms using combinations of pipeline tools.

Description:
We believe small businesses are at the heart of our communities, and championing them is worth fighting for. We empower small business owners to manage their finances fearlessly, by offering the simplest, all-in-one financial management solution they can't live without.
*
About the Role:*
Reporting to the Senior Manager of Data Platform and Operations, as an Analytics Engineer you will be building tools and infrastructure to support efforts of the analytics and data team as a whole.
We’re looking for a talented, curious self-starter who is driven to solve complex problems and can juggle multiple domains and stakeholders. This highly technical individual will collaborate with all levels of the Data team as well as the various operations teams (e.g. Risk, Finance, Compliance) to provide data solutions, improve our data models as the business scales, and advance Wave to the next stage in our transformation as a data-centric organization.

Description:
Trolley is the payouts platform for the internet economy. Our vision is to unlock the collective economic opportunity of the internet – for everyone – by building a truly global payouts ecosystem. Through our powerful platform and API, Trolley enables businesses to reach workers from all corners of the world and offers creators, on-demand workers, and suppliers the ability to bring their specialized talents to a global market. Businesses use Trolley to automate and manage payouts, collect recipient tax and banking information, and mitigate fraud and risk. The payouts solution of choice for hundreds of businesses, Trolley has made payouts to over 1.1 million different musicians, artists, makers, vendors, and suppliers around the world.

Trolley is seeking a self-driven, analytical individual to join our team as an Analytics Engineer. Reporting to the VP of Product, this role manages the end-to-end data pipeline. You will empower data-informed decisions for the Trolley team and our customers. The ideal candidate will have experience with the toolset required (ELT, Warehousing, BI, etc) and have driven healthy data cultures across organizations.

Description:
About GlossGenius
GlossGenius is building an ecosystem enabling entrepreneurs to succeed. We empower small businesses owners to focus on being creators, not admins, by offering a range of business management tools including booking and scheduling, marketing, analytics, payment processing and much more.
Tens of thousands of small business owners have chosen to rely on GlossGenius every day to run their entire set of business operations. With its powerful, intuitive platform, GlossGenius is some part a fintech company, some part an SMB software company, while its vibrant, distinguished brand makes it some part a consumer company.

Description:
BI Engineer
Push the boundaries of tech. In your sweatpants.
Alludo is looking for an experienced BI Engineer to help us change the way the world works. Here, you’ll facilitate the advancement of our analytical capabilities. We are moving from “what was/is” to Predictive modeling and Business optimization. This role will be the key to establishing and developing the data science capabilities at the company.
The top creative and technical minds could work anywhere. So why are so many of them choosing Alludo? Here are three reasons:

It’s an exciting time at Alludo, with new leadership, a refreshed brand (you probably know us as Corel!), and a whole new approach to changing the way the world works. We’re at the forefront of a movement, and we want you to ride this wave with us.

Description:
SS&C is a global provider of investment and financial services and software for the financial services and healthcare industries. Named to Fortune 1000 list as top U.S. company based on revenue, SS&C is headquartered in Windsor, Connecticut and has 20,000+ employees in over 90 offices in 35 countries. Some 18,000 financial services and healthcare organizations, from the world's largest institutions to local firms, manage and account for their investments using SS&C's products and services.
Job Description
Job Title: Financial Engineer / Business Analyst or SME
Location: Toronto, ON Canada
Get To Know The Team:
SS&C Technologies, Inc. (known as SS&C) is an American multinational financial technology company that provides software and software as a service to the financial services industry. The company has offices globally including the Americas, Europe, Asia, Africa, and Australia. Through its numerous acquired subsidiaries, such as Advent Software, Varden Technologies, Eze Software, and Primatics Financial, SS&C specializes in specific fintech markets, such as fund administration, wealth management accounting, and insurance and pension funds. SS&C acquired Algorithmics in 2019.

Description:
Purpose:
Accountable to the Manager, Operational Excellence, the Business Analyst and Process Engineer (BAPE) is responsible for supporting the PMO in servicing the customers, clients and stakeholders of York University. The BAPE provides subject matter and execution expertise in Lean, Six Sigma (or Lean Six Sigma) and business analysis disciplines. The BAPE provides counsel to University leadership on various topics ranging from business plans, policy and processes to staff levels and their roles. The BAPE is an agent of change leveraging best practices to affect them.Exposure to, and use of, sensitive and confidential financial and HR data for process development and re-engineering activities requires that the BAPE exercise strong judgement and discretion when disclosing information to a wider audience.

Education:
University degree preferably in business, engineering or computing. Green Belt Certification or higher in Lean Six Sigma or Six Sigma.Business Analyst Training/Certification. CCBA or CBAP certification an asset.Proficient in the use MS Project, MS Visio, MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, Access).Change Management certification (e.g. ProSci/ADKAR methodology) an assetKnowledge of collaborative systems such as Confluence and Basecamp an asset.


4+ years of progressive experience in Business Analysis and/or Process (Re-)Engineering roles with project responsibilities, and a good understanding of project management methodologies, work-flow/process design and re-engineering. cost/benefit analysis for medium, large or complex systems.Thorough knowledge of system and process analysis with demonstrated experience and expertise in requirements management, process development/re-engineering and testing skills including information gathering, problem solving, and test plan creation and execution.Proven experience in process and system analysis, documentation/validation of business requirements from business users and functional specification requirements using interviews, documented analysis, tasks and workflow analysis.Experience in the development and execution of project plans, detailed task lists (project Gantt) and time estimating.Demonstrated analytical and decision making ability.Strong written, verbal and presentation skills.Proven accuracy and attention to detail.Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively in a team environment.Good knowledge of system development lifecycle, methodologies, standards, tools and techniques. Ability to identify opportunities to use technology to add value and recognize and present opportunities for adoption of process efficiencies through automation to replace existing manual work (i.e. process re-engineering). Experience in project management and system implementation processes. Experience in a Higher Education is an asset.


Research and Analytical skills: Superior data gathering, elicitation, analytical and problem solving skills. highly skilled in evaluation of information gathered from multiple sources (including internal and external leading practices). Ability to reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.Problem Solving: Demonstrated ability to identify optimal solutions based on the analysis of causes.Process Re-engineering: Thorough knowledge of process development and re-engineering best practices in a business to business environment to lead, cross-functional teams to analyze, develop, re-engineer and implement business workflow processes to support business products and services.Process Mapping and Design: Ability to gather input from diverse user groups and develop current/future state process maps.Conceptual Thinking: Ability to make the complex simple or link together things not obviously related.Written communication: Strong writing skills to support business recommendations and proposals. Communicating details such as the business requirements, requested changes, issues with impact assessment and recommendations.Strong oral presentation skills: Excellent verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Ability to clearly convey complex concepts and constructs in a straightforward manner.Results oriented: Demonstrated initiative. delivers results. continuously improves. displays a dynamic approach, energy and enthusiasm. Flexible: Adaptable to different circumstances. receptive to change. willing to learn. takes on additional responsibility as required. able to change priorities. Effective planning and organizational skills with the ability to adapt to change and perform effectively under pressure.Judgment: Considers context. weighs options. understands priorities, consequences. makes appropriate decisions. Conscious of audience and disclosing of confidential information when discussing process re-engineering and introduction of technological change and automation that will impact staff and work assignments.Creativity: Ability to present new ideas. looks at things in a new way and shares ideas. novel approach to existing processes or problems. Initiative: Self-starter: perceives a need and fulfills it in a relevant way. Set high personal performance standards with a demonstrated ability to plan, organize and implement activity with little to no direct supervision.Manages change: Plans for and is proactive about change. encourages new approaches. Ability to work effectively in an environment of conflicting priorities, shifting management structures, scope changes and to adjust priorities as required. Tact and diplomacy: Ability to work within a complex organizational framework. comfortable tabling difficult conversations to further positive outcomes, including recommending changes in business methods and processes that will impact staffing levels and resource allocation.


This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.
York implemented a revised CPM Compensation Framework in 2019. The Framework is a salary grid consisting of 6 or 8 steps (depending on job grade) which is reviewed annually with possible adjustments, and a lump sum Performance Based Recognition Award. Employees will receive the grid adjustment and depending on performance, eligible permanent employees may move to the next step of the grid and may receive a lump sum Performance Based Recognition Award.Visit the CPM Compensation page on the HR Website to find out more about York's CPM Compensation Program.

Description:
Analytics Implementation Engineer
Do you have a passion for data and analytics?
As an Analytics Implementation Engineer on the Data & Analytics team, you will play a critical role enabling data collection for key business objectives and improving our implementation, you will be involved in the entire implementation process and play an active role in helping to define and execute on our analytics roadmap.
We practice a remote first working model, leveraging in person interactions at our head office, in beautiful Vancouver, BC, for strategic, collaborative, and social purposes.
Apply now and grow your career with our Data & Analytics team as an Analytics Implementation Engineer.

Work cross-functionally with analysts, agile development teams and business stakeholders to ensure tracking is in place for key business objectives

Description:
The Capital and Maintenance Program Analyst is responsible for the effective business operations associated with Toronto Hydro-Electric Systems Limited (THESL) Capital and Maintenance programs and operating expenses. Responsibilities include: data gathering, data analysis, identifying gaps and trends as well as producing reports related to the THESL Capital and Maintenance Work Programs. The incumbent will develop processes, procedures and tools to ensure governance and compliance in the delivery of the THESL Capital and Maintenance Execution Work Program. The Analyst will also develop databases and automated reports to assist leaders and external stakeholders in the efficient and effective management of the capital work programs and provide support to the ongoing responsibilities.

The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.

Description:
(This role is fully remote for candidates located in British Columbia.)
Rec Room is the best place to build and play games together. Chat, hang out, explore MILLIONS of rooms, or build something new to share with us all! Rec Room is growing rapidly, with our data growing even faster. We're looking for experienced data professionals to come and build out the foundational infrastructure at Rec Room.
As the Analytics Engineering Manager, you'll drive the vision for our data warehouse and analytics layer, setting us up to scale in both the number of players and internal users. You'll manage our growing AE team, mentoring and building out best practices, and encouraging a culture of learning. You'll partner with leads across the company to ensure we have the right level of visibility into our business and drive the broader architectural vision for the warehouse and associated data processes at Rec Room.

Job_title: Senior Manager, Project Delivery Business Analyst, Retail & Small Business (Contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 176293

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

The world is changing faster than ever and so are we!

“Big data” fed by “complex processes” representing “massive stakes” are not just buzzwords to us; they are a genuine reflection of our daily life. Our goal is to be nothing less than The Leading Bank in The Americas that puts Customers First. Achieving this will require us to assemble a Winning Team that can not only design highly predictive decisioning and forecasting models but even more importantly: models that actually accurately reflect reality. To put things in perspective, our models underpin automated risk-management decisions and forecasts that impact millions of customers and keep hundreds of $billions safe, every single day. We are fortunate to have a world-class team of Data Scientists and Model Operations personnel building and deploying incredible risk models. But they need your help.
